question:
Which one of the following is correctly matched?
Ethnic Indians President/ Prime Minister of
(a) Sir Aneerood Jugnauth Fiji
(b) Ramsevak Shankar Suriname
(c) Sir Veeraswamy Ringadoo Guyana
(d) Dr. Thimoa Bavadra Mauritius
explanation:
• Sir Anerood Jugnauth is a Mauritian Barrister, statesman and politician who has served as both President and Prime Minister of Mauritius. He is Member of Parliament for Piton & Riviere Du Rempart.
• Ramsewak Shankar is a Surinamese politician who was the 4th President of Suriname, serving from 1988 to 1990. His government was overthrown by Desi Bouterse leading a bloodless military coup. Shankar had previously served as Agriculture & Fisheries Minister from 1969 to 1971.
• Moses Veerasammy Nagamootoo is a Guyanese politician and writer who has been Prime Minister of Guyana since 2015.
• Timoci Uluivuda Bavadra was Prime Minister of Fiji from 14 April to 19 May 1987.
